1. Initially, object 1 and object 6 were on the machine, but the light was off.
2. When all objects (0-7) were placed on the machine, the light remained off.

4. When object 0 was removed, the light turned off again.
5. No other single object (including object 7) caused the machine to turn on when placed alone or in combinations.

From this, we can infer:
- Object 0 is definitely a blicket (since its presence causes the machine to turn on).
- Object 7 has never caused the machine to turn on in any tested configuration.
- The rule appears to be that the machine turns on if and only if object 0 is present on it.

> False
